result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher R Wasielewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

The Court will consider expungement upon petition of defendant and successful completion of any or all of the following:
Probation
Timely payment of fines in full.
No further criminal activity.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher R Wasielewski in court with attorney Thomas J. Parins.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea Questionnaire filed w/NC plea.  Exhibit 1 offered.  ADA Niemi makes recommendation.  Court reviews rights, charges & penalties w/DE.  DE pleads NC.  Court accepts waiver, plea, Ex. 1, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty.  Closing statements.  ADA Niemi recommends expungement for Count 2, NOT Count 1.  Court questions ADA re: expungement of Count 1.  Court follows recommendation, grants expungement on BOTH counts.  Appeal right given to DE.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: Hearing Notice - hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant Christopher R Wasielewski in court with attorney Thomas J. Parins.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives reading of the complaint and enters a NG plea.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Hearing Notice - hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant Christopher R Wasielewski in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Defendant to see public defender's office today by 4 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
